div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

p.a: Event: Highly Capable Nomination Packets Due

div.p:
Highly Capable Nomination packets are due May 1st. If you want to learn more about our program, visit our website at: https://www.cpps.org/o/district/page/highly-capable
We will not be testing this spring, due to the school closure, but will keep your application and test your student when we reopen in the fall.

Los paquetes de nominación de alta capacidad deben presentarse el 1 de mayo. Si desea obtener más información sobre nuestro programa, puede hacerlo visitando nuestro sitio web en:https://www.cpps.org/o/district/page/highly-capable
No haremos pruebas esta primavera, debido al cierre de la escuela, pero conservaremos su solicitud y evaluaremos a su estudiante cuando volvamos a abrir en el otoño.
Davis Parents: Mr. Ferraro and Mr. Plucker are offering an opportunity to join via Zoom to check-in with you!

Sign Up for the Zoom Here (Spanish Coming Soon):
https://forms.gle/GgYRNoB4MMD2LVJm7
Look what our daycare kids at Davis did for our food service heros! They are here and at Sager everyday feeding our CPPS students and families! Thank You!

Estudiantes de Sager : Los maestros empacaron toda la ropa de educación física. Si dejaste tu ropa, pasa por la escuela en los siguientes tiempos. 7o- el martes 10AM-2PM. 8º Grado el miércoles 10AM-2 PM. Si se necesita otro tiempo, envíe un correo electrónico al Sr. Kasenga

7th & 8th Graders: Mr. Sloan & Ms. Kelly Labeled & Bagged all the PE clothes in the locker room. If you left your clothes stop by the school at the following times. 7th Grade Tuesday 10 AM-2 PM 8th Grade Wednesday 10 AM-2 PM If another time is needed please email Mr. Kasenga.

College Place Public Schools does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, honorably-discharged veteran or military status, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, or the use of a trained guide dog or service animal by a person with a disability, and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights, Title IX and Section 504 Coordinator: James Fry, (509) 525-4827, jfry@cpps.org,1755 South College Avenue, College Place, Washington, 99324
